name: places/ChIJF9Smpx1ZwokRZ80wKrouBug
formattedAddress: 386 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 386 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: If you plan on getting your car or parking your car after 11 p.m. the only way to get them to open the gate is by walking over to the building next door and asking their doorman to call the garage for you to have them open it. Their Bell has never worked. Ever. I've tried to get in there three times over the course of two years and all three times the Bell has still been broken. So I am done. They do not care about their customers. Good luck getting in and Have fun having to walk over to the building next door in the freezing cold because they have no way of getting in!

originalText.text:
Used a park app (SpotHero) and reserved the parking for 5 nights from out of state. Drove in and left the key at around 4:30pm on Saturday and was given a ticket with instruction to send text one hour ahead of pickup time.

I texted them an hour ahead of pickup time. Got confirmation message later. When I showed up at the garage at around 7pm, my car was there waiting for me. Showed the ticket and got the receipt and key and drove away.

No hassle, very smooth experience. Will definitely use it again in the future.

originalText.text: I use a parking app so that I can avoid unexpected "fees" and so my wife with the baby can have a relatively hassle free experience. I have an SUV so I PRE PAY the Oversized fee. Well this garage decides to hold my car hostage unless I pay another Oversized fee on TOP of the already PAID oversize fee. Even showing them the receipt with paid fee they refused to release the car. Don't use these scammers

originalText.text: Wow! That happened to me with them 2 nights ago! I rang their broken buzzer 10 times and started banging on the gate. Nobody would answer. So now I just Googled their business to look for a number and found the previous review saying that I have to walk over to the building next door! Oh well, I guess I did the right thing by finding a different garage. This was my first attempt at using them and now I guess I never will!
